alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Cumberland; Eastern Louisa; Fluvanna; Goochland; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway; Powhatan; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 12:37PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Louisa, Mecklenburg, Cumberland, Prince Edward, western Lunenburg, northwestern Nottoway, western Goochland, northwestern Amelia, western Powhatan and Fluvanna Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 1237 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Centenary to near Cluster Springs. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fork Union around 115 PM EDT. Palmyra and Buffalo Springs around 120 PM EDT. Clarksville, Columbia and Duncan around 130 PM EDT. Hadensville, Boydton, Kents Store and Fife around 145 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Tuggle, Wilburn, Angola, Arvins Store, Three Square, Nutbush, Finneywood, Central Plains, Hawk and Fairview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and south central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Cumberland; Eastern Louisa; Fluvanna; Goochland; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway; Powhatan; Prince Edward
